summary: This document appears to be an internal correction report from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding a procedural error in logging. Staff used the wrong logbook (an 'I/M companion log') instead of the required 'Staff Suicide Watch log' for monitoring an inmate. The error was discovered and a second, correct log was completed with identical entries.

persons.name: DTS
persons.role: Person who discovered the logging error
persons.context: Discovered that the wrong logbook (I/M companion log) was being used instead of the required Staff Suicide Watch log.

connections.description: Both are staff members at MCC New York involved in the correction of a procedural logging error.

events.title: Logging Error and Correction at MCC New York
events.description: Staff at MCC New York used an 'I/M companion log' instead of the required 'Staff Suicide Watch log' for monitoring an inmate. The error was discovered by DTS, and a second, correct log was completed with identical entries, initialed by M.

locations.name: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York
locations.context: The federal detention facility where the procedural logging error occurred.

keyFacts: A procedural error occurred at MCC New York where staff used an 'I/M companion log' instead of the mandated 'Staff Suicide Watch log'.
The error was discovered by an individual identified as DTS.
A corrected log was completed using the proper Suicide Watch log, with entries identical to the first, incorrect log, and was initialed by a staff member identified as M.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case files related to Epstein.
